receivable.translation[1].definitions[1]: money owed to a business by its clients and shown in its accounts as an asset
The company had more than $10 million in cash and $10 million in accounts receivable.
receivable.translation[1].definitions[2]: a note relating to money that a company is owed
It said the estimated adjustments are for write-downs on the carrying value of its assets - primarily notes receivable.
